means: 使欣喜( delight的过去式和过去分词)

sentence.Network_en: "You must come to Tinsley's graduation party." — "I'd be delighted."
sentence.Network_cn: “你一定要来参加廷斯利的毕业聚会。”——“我很乐意。”

sentence.Network_en: She stood preening in their midst, delighted with the attention.
sentence.Network_cn: 她得意洋洋地站在他们中间，为受人瞩目而高兴。

sentence.Network_en: The news will have delighted detractors of the scheme.
sentence.Network_cn: 这条消息会让该方案的批评者感到高兴。

entry.def: If you are delighted, you are extremely pleased and excited about something.

example.ex: I know Frank will be delighted to see you...
example.tran: 我知道弗兰克见到你会很高兴的。

example.ex: He said that he was delighted with the public response.
example.tran: 他说公众的反应让他欣喜。

entry.def: If someone invites or asks you to do something, you can say that you would be delighted to do it, as a way of showing that you are very willing to do it.

example.ex: 'You must come to Tinsley's graduation party.' — 'I'd be delighted.'
example.tran: “你一定要来参加廷斯利的毕业聚会。”——“我很乐意。”

auth_sentence.content: We're delighted to share that even more widely.
auth_sentence.res_content: We're delighted to share that even more widely.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We're delighted to share that even more widely.

auth_sentence.content: He has delighted us with his work since Newbury.
auth_sentence.res_content: He has delighted us with his work since Newbury.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He has delighted us with his work since Newbury.

sentences.cn: 我为你的成功感到高兴。
